title: Business & Finance
text:
Apple's privacy change on how users are tracked on mobile devices is starting to disrupt the online ad market, hurting e-commerce players and creating challenges for some tech firms.

---

Shares of a blank-check company tied to Trump's new online network surged again amid a buying frenzy fueled by individual investors on social media.

---

The Fed's Powell indicated he is now somewhat more concerned about higher inflation and said the central bank is keeping careful watch.

---

The Dow added 0.2% to close at a record, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell 0.1% and 0.8%, respectively.

---

Boy band BTS agreed to a distribution and marketing deal with Universal Music for the U.S. and other regions, parting ways with Sony Music's Columbia Records.

---

Goldman is giving CEO Solomon and President Waldron one-time stock bonuses designed to keep them at the bank's helm.
